title: 64th Annual Art in the Park Fall Foliage Festival
description: Chaffee Art Center's 64th Annual [Summer and] Fall Foliage Art in the Park Festivals will take place on [August 9 & 10 and] October 11 & 12. Juried fine artists, craftspeople, and specialty food producers will be featured. Rounding out the festival are food vendors, live music, Free kids' activities, and demonstrations of works in progress held throughout the weekend. Hours: Saturday 10am to 5pm and Sunday 10am to 4pm. A voluntary donation is appreciated. Shows will be held rain (snow) or shine in Main Street Park at Junction of Routes 4 & 7 in Rutland, Vermont. APPLICATIONS ARE BEING ACCEPTED https://www.chaffeeartcenter.org/art-in-the-park/exhibitor-information/. Shows draw attendees from Vermont and adjacent states plus tourists who travel to/through Vermont. Estimated attendance 6000+. Exhibitors consistently report good sales and a high degree of satisfaction with the events. 802-775-0356

title: Northeastern Oddfellows Association Camp
description:
The Vermont Oddfellows are offering scholarships and transport to Camp NEOFA in Montville Maine, a coed camp for kids ages 8-14.

For More than 50 years Camp NEOFA has provided a safe, healthy environment where children can make new friends, creating life-long memories and positive diverse experiences.

Camp NEOFA is committed to providing every camper with a Safe, and Fun filled summer camping experience.

Coed Youth Camping Open to ANY Youngster Between 8 - 14

The NEOFA campus currently consists of 12 cabins, each housing up to 10 people, and five ancillary buildings.  The "Castle", located adjacent to the dining hall, is the last remaining building from the old Montville Fairgrounds.

There are more than 100 acres of open fields, pine groves and undeveloped land, with 2,300 feet of water frontage on beautiful True's Pond.

Our staff is committed to providing every camper with a safe, and fun-filled summer camping experience.  Many youngsters return year after year; and, when they are too old to come as campers, they return to help younger children have the same exciting camping experience they enjoyed.

Please feel free to contact me directly with questions!

title: Owen Leavey LIVE at Spotlight Vintage
description:
Spotlight Vintage is not just a vintage clothing store, our mission is to uplift the arts in our area by creating opportunities for artists of all kinds to showcase their talents.

We are thrilled to welcome local VT musician Owen Leavey to our “Forever Young Stage” right inside our storefront!

Owen Leavey is a Vermont-based pianist and vocalist who loves turning good songs into great vibes. From jazzy classics to heartfelt pop, Owen brings a little soul to every set.

Come shop our unique vintage collections from multiple vendors while enjoying Owen’s sultry vocal set on Saturday July 19th, from 2-3pm.

Located at 20 N. Main Street, Downtown St. Albans, VT.

title: Gather Together Monthly Community Social!
description: Join Social Tinkering for our FREE Gather Together event, a welcoming and inclusive community social for people all ages designed to meet participants at their comfort level for socializing. Games, puzzles, and other activities provided. Bring along your knitting or a favorite musical instrument or game. Light refreshments provided. Come check this out anytime between 6-8pm, no set agenda, just hanging out with friends. This is an opportunity to meet other people, grow friendships, and help build community in a relaxed space with a down-to-earth group of people. New to town? Looking to grow your social circle? Going through a life transition? We look forward to meeting you! ( Pssst! Even if you are already a social butterfly, we'd love to meet you - social butterflies can help with the nerves of social anxiety.) We gather in the white building at the Vermont Farmers Food Center campus - look for our sign! To learn more about Social Tinkering, visit our website at https://www.socialtinkering.org

title: Women's Circle Monthly Social & Discussion Group
description: Join Social Tinkering for our FREE Women's Circle event, a welcoming and inclusive monthly social and discussion space for women and gender expansive folks aged 18 and up. Together, we honor and celebrate our feminine life experiences and explore how we can use the power of connection to help us and our communities thrive. Each month centers on a different aspect of social connection as we make space for people to meet and talk casually between light activities and discussion. This group is set up for you to participate at the social level you are comfortable with. No pressure and a relaxing atmosphere where you can be yourself. Join us for a cup of tea or cocoa and some fun and interesting conversation to grow your social circle! We meet at the Vermont Farmers Food Center in the white building - look for our Social Tinkering sign! To learn more, go to https://www.socialtinkering.org

title: Death, Dying, Danishes
description: The VNA & Hospice of the Southwest Region (VNAHSR) offers a discussion group designed to address a topic many have difficulty talking about: death and dying. Led by Hospice volunteers, the objective of Death, Dying, & Danishes is to increase awareness of death and to encourage people to make the most of their lives. Sharing food creates a relaxed and nurturing environment where the group can join open, honest conversations to explore the questions about life, dying and grief. People of all ages are encouraged to bring their questions, experiences, and thoughts to the gathering. The goal is simply to provide a forum for community members to come together in a relaxed atmosphere over coffee, tea, and goodies to share thought-provoking and life-affirming conversation. The event is free and open to the public, but purchases are encouraged for host sites. Those looking for more information prior to attending can contact Mary Pleasant at 802.442.0540 or by emailing at mary.pleasant@vnahsr.org

title: Burlington: An Evening with Alison Bechdel: Spent
description:
Please join us at Phoenix Books in Burlington for an evening with award-winning author Alison Bechdel, to celebrate the release of her comic novel. Spent.

In Alison Bechdel’s hilariously skewering and gloriously cast new comic novel confection, a cartoonist named Alison Bechdel, running a pygmy goat sanctuary in Vermont, is existentially irked by a climate-challenged world and a citizenry on the brink of civil war. She wonders: Can she pull humanity out of its death spiral by writing a scathingly self-critical memoir about her own greed and privilege?

Meanwhile, Alison’s first graphic memoir about growing up with her father, a taxidermist who specialized in replicas of Victorian animal displays, has been adapted into a highly successful TV series. It’s a phenomenon that makes Alison, formerly on the cultural margins, the envy of her friend group (recognizable as characters, now middle-aged and living communally in Vermont, from Bechdel’s beloved comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For).

As the TV show Death and Taxidermy racks up Emmy after Emmy—and when Alison’s Pauline Bunyanesque partner Holly posts an instructional wood-chopping video that goes viral—Alison’s own envy spirals. Why couldn’t she be the writer for a critically lauded and wildly popular reality TV show…like Queer Eye...showing people how to free themselves from consumer capitalism and live a more ethical life?!!

Spent’s rollicking and masterful denouement—making the case for seizing what’s true about life in the world at this moment, before it’s too late—once again proves that “nobody does it better” (New York Times Book Review) than the real Alison Bechdel.

Alison Bechdel’s cult following for her early comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For expanded wildly for her family memoirs, the New York Times bestselling and Time magazine #1 Book of the Year graphic memoir Fun Home, adapted into a Tony Award–winning musical, and Are You My Mother? Most recently, The Secret to Superman Strength was named a New York Times Best Graphic Novel of 2021. Bechdel has been named a MacArthur Fellow, among many other honors.

DATE:  Tuesday, June 10th, 7PM

LOCATION:  Phoenix Books, 89 Church Street, Burlington, VT 05401

ADMISSION:  This is a ticketed event. Your ticket includes general admission for one, and one hardcover copy of Spent. Tickets can be purchased at the bottom of this page.  Seating is limited and will be on a first come, first served basis.  A signing line will follow the event.

title: Ageless Art: Kindness Rocks for Every Generation
description:
Looking for a fun, creative way to connect with your community? Join us for Ageless Art: Kindness Rocks for Every Generation, a free intergenerational rock painting event hosted by the Southwestern Vermont Council on Aging!

This event welcomes people of all ages—children, families, adults, and older adults. Come together to paint colorful rocks with positive messages or uplifting designs, then share them around the community to spread kindness and joy.

Event Details:

🗓️ Date: Saturday, June 7, 2025

🕙 Time: 10:00 AM – 12:00 PM

📍 Location: Southwestern Vermont Council on Aging, 143 Maple Street, Rutland, VT

We're thrilled to be collaborating with Kaleidoscope Art Supply, and an on-site art instructor will be there to provide creative inspiration and help with all materials. SVCOA staff will also be on hand to assist and ensure a welcoming, joyful experience for everyone.

This is a wonderful opportunity to build connections, break down age barriers, and brighten someone's day!

Let us know you'll be attending so we can be sure to have enough supplies and snacks! Sign up is quick and easy at the event website.

Let's paint, connect, and share a little kindness—one rock at a time!

title: VT Neighbors Day
description:
In 2018, Vermont became the first state in the U.S. to hold a statewide celebration of Neighbors Day, falling on the first Saturday of June.

Gather with neighbors on your road, in your neighborhood, or in your part of town in a way that reflects the personality of your local community. The goal is to get to know the people living closest to you!

Not gathering? Today is a great day to reach out to connect with those who live nearby with a wave, good chat, or act of kindness.

title: Green Mountain Roller Derby Punk's Not Dead Double Header
description: Green Mountain Roller Derby is bringing punk rock back to the derby track! Join Vermont’s premier roller derby league on Saturday, May 24, for a home game homage to the counterculture that paved the way for the rise of our sport. Cheer on home teams Grade A Fancy and The Juggernauts in back-to-back bouts against Hartford Area Roller Derby and Monadnock Roller Derby. Don’t forget to bring non-perishable items for donation to the Montpelier Food Pantry, because giving back to your community is punk rock. Doors open at 3:00 pm, first whistle at 4:00. Game 1: Green Mountain Roller Derby Grade A Fancy vs. Hartford Area Roller Derby Game 2: Green Mountain Roller Derby Juggernauts vs. Monadnock Roller Derby Tickets: https://www.sevendaystickets.com/e/gmrd-may2025?utm_source=affiliate&utm_name=Facebook&utm_campaign=Facebook&utm_id=680809b660d04f6d8a8238120a1e6253

title: Vermont Specter Squad, Fox Room
description: https://rutlandfree.assabetinteractive.com/meeting-and-study-rooms/paranormal-investigation-at-the-haunted-fox-room/ Paranormal Investigation at the Haunted Fox Room: Join the Vermont Specter Squad for an intriguing night of exploration on Saturday, May 24, 2025, as we delve into the mysteries of the haunted Fox Room at the Rutland Free Library! If you've ever felt a chill down your spine or wondered what lies beyond the veil, this is the perfect opportunity to satisfy your curiosity. Bring along your own paranormal investigation equipment if you have it, or come ready to try out some tools we'll have on hand. Together, we'll collect and share our findings in the enchanting and eerie ambiance of the Fox Room. Whether you're a seasoned ghost hunter or just curious about the supernatural, everyone is welcome to contribute to our investigation. Feel free to bring along light snacks like cereal bars and bottled water to keep your energy up as we explore. Just a friendly reminder: we'll be focusing on investigation techniques, so please leave the Ouija boards and séance tools at home. This is a unique chance to connect with others who share your interests and perhaps even encounter something unexpected. Join us for an unforgettable night of mystery and discovery! We can't wait to see you there!
